column6: When they go after Hassan the Assassin, Deux-Deux gives the Inspector an unlucky rabbit's foot.
The Commissioner is overworked and needs absolute quiet or he goes into uncontrolled fits of temper. The Inspector is assigned to look after him, but has trouble with a noisy cat.
The Commissioner is kidnapped by aliens, and the Inspector goes to rescue him.
column7: Music score is set to Ottorino Respighi's Pines of Rome.

column6: The Inspector is sent after biker Pig Al and his biker gang.
The Inspector is given Private Bowser, a very energetic dog, in his efforts to track down a thief.
After being fired for letting Louie Le Finke escape, the Inspector tries to stop him from taking vengeance on the Commissioner, but ends up becoming part of the manhunt himself.
